titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 6) to enhance energy conservation and research and development, to provide for security and diversity in the energy supply for the American people, and for other purposes.

Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 6) to enhance energy conservation and research and development, to provide for security and diversity in the energy supply for the American people, and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 108-69, by Mr. Hastings (WA).

Rule provides for a structured rule providing one hour and 30 minutes of general debate with 30 minutes equally divided and controlled by the chairman and ranking minority member of the Committee on Energy and Commerce and 20 minutes equally divided and controlled by the chairmen and ranking minority members of each of the following Committees: Science, Resources, and Ways and Means. The rule waives all points of order against consideration of the bill. Makes in order amendments printed in the Rules Committee report (H. Rept. 108-70). Provides that the amendments may be offered only in the order printed in the report, offered only by a Member designated, considered as read, debatable for the time specified in the report, shall not be subject to amendment or be subject to a demand for division of the question in the House or in the Committee.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 22.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 189.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 226 - 202 (Roll no. 130).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 236 - 190 (Roll no. 131).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: (This measure has not been amended since it was introduced in the House on April 10, 2003. The summary of that version is repeated here.)Sets forth the rule for consideration of H.R. 6 (enhancing energy conservation and addressing the issues of security and diversity in the energy supply for the American people).
